name: Dumbbell Push-Up
how_to_perform:
1. Start by positioning your dumbbells on either side of you so that they are at a comfortable distance to perform a push-up.
2. Place your hands shoulder-width apart on the dumbbells, ensuring that your fingers face forward and your hands grip evenly. Engage your core and maintain proper posture throughout the exercise.
3. Lower yourself down toward the ground by bending your elbows until your upper arms are parallel to the ground. Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels, with your neck relaxed and your shoulders dropped away from your ears.
4. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, ensuring that your core remains engaged and your body doesn't touch the dumbbells.
5. Push yourself back up to the starting position by extending your arms fully and elevating yourself up off the ground. Ensure that you keep your movements controlled throughout the exercise.
short_summary: The Dumbbell Push-Up is an upper body exercise that primarily works the chest muscles, targeting the pectoralis major.
